name: The Black Stone
text:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: -X. X is the [[Altered]] value of your location.
[cultist]: -1. If you fail, search the encounter deck and discard pile for a [[Cultist]] enemy and draw it.
[tablet]: Reveal another token. If you fail, place 1 horror on the nearest [[Altered]] location.
[elder_thing]: -4. If you fail, place 1 doom on a [[Cultist]] enemy.
back_text:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: -X. X is 2 greater than the [[Altered]] value of your location.
[cultist]: -3. If you fail, search the encounter deck and discard pile for a [[Cultist]] enemy and draw it.
[tablet]: Reveal another token. Place 1 horror on the nearest [[Altered]] location.
[elder_thing]: -6. Place 1 doom on each [[Cultist]] enemy.

flavor:
Well for Justin Geoffrey that he tarried there only in the sunlight and went his way, for had he gazed upon that ghastly conclave, his mad brain would have snapped before it did. How my own reason held, I do not know.
- Robert Howard, "The Black Stone"
name: Justin Geoffrey
text:
You get +1 [intellect].
[reaction] When you would draw a card, exhaust Justin Geoffrey: instead, search the top 3 cards of your deck for a card, draw it, and shuffle the remaining cards into your deck.

flavor:
And I suddenly saw a connection between this Stone and a certain weird and fantastic poem written by the mad poet Justin Geoffrey: The People of the Monolith.
- Robert Howard, "The Black Stone"
name: People of the Monolith
text:
[reaction] After your turn ends: Heal 1 horror.
[fast] Take 1 horror: You get +1 [intellect] for this skill test.
[fast] Take 1 horror: You get +1 [willpower] for this skill test.
